issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
To replicate: stop the SC during a snapshot operation. On restart it should have the pending snapshots in the 'failed' state in the eucalyptus-shared.eucalpytus_storage.snapshots table.

Functionally, regression checks should be sufficient.

[~zhill],

I followed your steps to replicate, however I observed a different behavior.  After I restarted the SC, and waited till all cloud services reached an 'ENABLED' state, I checked the status of the snapshot, and it showed that it 'failed':
{code}
# euca-describe-snapshots snap-8e5b217f --region admin-account2@vmware
SNAPSHOT	snap-8e5b217f	vol-1646b9fd	failed	2015-01-17T06:56:12.735Z	4%	881029380924	10
{code}
However in the eucalyptus-shared.eucalyptus_storage.snapshots table, there wasn't any information regarding this snapshot:
{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshots where snapshot_name ='snap-8e5b217f';
 id | creation_timestamp | last_update_timestamp | metadata_perm_uuid | version | progress | sc_name | should_transfer | snapshot_size_gb | snapshot_point_id | snapshot_name |
snapshot_location | start_time | status | snapshot_user_name | volume_name
----+--------------------+-----------------------+--------------------+---------+----------+---------+-----------------+------------------+-------------------+---------------+-
------------------+------------+--------+--------------------+-------------
(0 rows)
{code}
I did see the snapshot when I checked the eucalyptus_shared.eucalyptus_storage.snapshot_upload_info and eucalyptus_shared.eucalyptus_storage.snapshot_part tables:
{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshot_upload_info where snapshot_id = 'snap-8e5b217f';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                bucket_name
    | etag |   key_name    | purge_time | sc_name |  snapshot_id  |     state     | total_parts |                            upload_id
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------
----+------+---------------+------------+---------+---------------+---------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------------------
 8aef81ff4af549a7014af6aeb0630d9f | 2015-01-16 22:57:31.235 | 2015-01-16 22:57:57.775 | 13f55dad-23f7-4cfb-96b1-c8e4bb2c9cbd |       1 | snapshots-99d853b77b9d41dc9d8d7b46eef53
aee |      | snap-8e5b217f |            | one     | snap-8e5b217f | creatingparts |             | R7JMNUM3POLID1OMQDAXVJ1CYHUBN6O7HVA9HWD8PCL1QVYDLTU6LBFHAZRPEV6J
(1 row)

eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshot_part where snapshot_id = 'snap-8e5b217f';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                bucket_name
    |               etag               |                file_name                 | input_file_bytes_read | input_file_read_offset | is_last |   key_name    | part_number | sc_
name |   size    |  snapshot_id  |  state   |                            upload_id
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------
----+----------------------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------------------+------------------------+---------+---------------+-------------+----
-----+-----------+---------------+----------+------------------------------------------------------------------
 8aef81ff4af549a7014af6af182b0da4 | 2015-01-16 22:57:57.803 | 2015-01-16 22:57:57.803 | caad8d85-ca30-4963-95ac-a03fe5b1fcff |       0 | snapshots-99d853b77b9d41dc9d8d7b46eef53
aee |                                  | /tmp/snap-8e5b217f-7378820719533382321-2 |                       |              460324864 |         | snap-8e5b217f |           2 | one
     |           | snap-8e5b217f | creating | R7JMNUM3POLID1OMQDAXVJ1CYHUBN6O7HVA9HWD8PCL1QVYDLTU6LBFHAZRPEV6J
 8aef81ff4af549a7014af6aeb06f0da0 | 2015-01-16 22:57:31.247 | 2015-01-16 22:58:00.535 | 06bac921-7bc7-41c9-8291-6072f565c22b |       3 | snapshots-99d853b77b9d41dc9d8d7b46eef53
aee | f4c6b589528e12a7d6d697521a41747b | /tmp/snap-8e5b217f-6256800152488078527-1 |             460324864 |                      0 | f       | snap-8e5b217f |           1 | one
     | 104963419 | snap-8e5b217f | uploaded | R7JMNUM3POLID1OMQDAXVJ1CYHUBN6O7HVA9HWD8PCL1QVYDLTU6LBFHAZRPEV6J
(2 rows)
{code}

A couple of questions here:

# Is this the proper behavior for this use case?
# If not, is this dependent upon how far along the snapshot has progressed?

Let me know if you have any questions.
[~zhill]/[~swathi] - any update here?  Let me know if you guys need me to provide any additional information.

After syncing with [~swathi], looks like there is more work that needs to be done here to resolve this issue.  Therefore, I am rejecting this fix due to the information provided in my attempt to verify the issue earlier.

The state of the snapshot_upload_info entity should be marked as "aborted". Async cleanup process would then lookup up the aborted snapshot, perform the necessary clean up and update the state accordingly.
[~hspencer], I verified the fix using the same test as you did. Let me know what you think
[~hspencer], sorry I missed this earlier. You probably see the cleanup happening too quickly so it scrubs the records before you view them.

Hey [~zhill]/[~swathi],

I tested this out on [Shared #2 Cloud|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/QA+Shared+Setups#QASharedSetups-SharedSetup#2(VPC)] (4.1.1-0.0.23131.46.20150323git2700de0.el6), and this time, the DB looks good (from what I can tell), but from the output of 'euca-describe-snapshots', the snapshot is still in _pending_ state:
{code}
$ euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-3fc9561f	vol-6dbfdf33	pending	2015-03-26T21:38:24.748Z	1%	926336961615	20
{code}

Database information for the snapshot:
{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshots where snapshot_name = 'snap-3fc9561f';
 id | creation_timestamp | last_update_timestamp | metadata_perm_uuid | version | progress | sc_name | should_transfer | snapshot_size_gb | snapshot_point_id | snapshot_name |
 snapshot_location | start_time | status | snapshot_user_name | volume_name
----+--------------------+-----------------------+--------------------+---------+----------+---------+-----------------+------------------+-------------------+---------------+
-------------------+------------+--------+--------------------+-------------
(0 rows)

eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshot_upload_info where snapshot_id = 'snap-3fc9561f';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                bucket_name
     | etag |   key_name    |  purge_time   | sc_name |  snapshot_id  |  state  | total_parts | upload_id
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+---------------------------------------
-----+------+---------------+---------------+---------+---------------+---------+-------------+-----------
 8aef85a14c522d27014c58060e2a0084 | 2015-03-26 14:38:54.122 | 2015-03-26 14:43:58.413 | 1b6a5343-cac2-426f-b1d5-816eba1c9e11 |       2 | snapshots-9d3d31d4e01a4876b7233c66dd45
db59 |      | snap-3fc9561f | 1427409838412 | one     | snap-3fc9561f | cleaned |             |
(1 row)

eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshot_part where snapshot_id = 'snap-3fc9561f';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                bucket_name
     | etag |                file_name                 | input_file_bytes_read | input_file_read_offset | is_last |   key_name    | part_number | sc_name | size |  snapshot_id
  |  state  | upload_id
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+---------------------------------------
-----+------+------------------------------------------+-----------------------+------------------------+---------+---------------+-------------+---------+------+-------------
--+---------+-----------
 8aef85a14c522d27014c58060e3d0085 | 2015-03-26 14:38:54.141 | 2015-03-26 14:43:58.413 | 3055c104-1c1f-4e05-84ce-00bf71ebdb6f |       1 | snapshots-9d3d31d4e01a4876b7233c66dd45
db59 |      | /tmp/snap-3fc9561f-1729509494389175843-1 |                       |                      0 |         | snap-3fc9561f |           1 | one     |      | snap-3fc9561
f | cleaned |
(1 row)
{code}

The SC here is using NetApp.  The snapshot has been in _pending_ state for about 20 minutes.  

Let me know if you need any additional information here.
Snapshot is in 'pending' state, even though database shows that that snapshot state is 'cleaned'.

[~hspencer], I think the snapshot clean up process kicked in when SC started. This means that the snapshot is marked as failed in the SC's database, followed by clean up on the backend and finally the snapshot record is removed from the SC's database. Removal of the record from the SC may cause the snapshot to be entirely skipped from the first (periodic) describe snapshots process between CLC and SC. As a result, the CLC may never be privy to the state change of this snapshot. This explains how the CLC state of the snapshot was stuck in pending.

A major part of the problem is volume/snapshot lifecycle management on the CLC, we might need a different bug to track the lifecycle management issue. A smaller part of the problem is the inconsistent database record clean up on SCs and it should be addressed by fixes for EUCA-10614
Thanks [~swathi].  Did you need me to create another ticket regarding this?  What does it mean about this issue (i.e. do we close it, link it as a 'relates to' to the new ticket, etc.)?

[~hspencer], I verified the fix with the use case in your previous comments. Do you have an automated test for this? I was planning on writing something that could be included in eutester but wanted to check if you already had one up and about.

[~swathi],

No automated test yet.  I have been doing the test manually.  I can still do it manually while you write the eutester case (or I can do it).  Just let me know.
[~hspencer], yep, put it through the same manual test and let me know how it goes. I'll update the ticket with the automated test case when I have it ready. Thanks!

Fix approved. Solid work [~swathi] and [~zhill].

Eucalyptus version:  {{4.2.0-0.0.23318.461.20150515git8f6aa11.el6}}

*Steps To Confirm Fix*

# Used non-'eucalyptus' account on [QA Shared Setup #1|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/QA+Shared+Setups#QASharedSetups-SharedSetup#1] (i.e. multi-cluster, SC01 - DAS, SC02 - NetApp)
{code}
# euca-describe-storage-controllers
STORAGECONTROLLER	two            	two-sc-1       	10.111.5.23              	ENABLED	{}
STORAGECONTROLLER	one            	one-sc-1       	10.111.5.5               	ENABLED	{}
# euca-describe-properties one.storage.blockstoragemanager
PROPERTY	one.storage.blockstoragemanager	das
# euca-describe-properties two.storage.blockstoragemanager
PROPERTY	two.storage.blockstoragemanager	netapp
{code}
# Created a volume under each AZ (i.e. cluster)
{code}
# euca-create-volume -s 10 -z one
VOLUME	vol-7074a3a8	10		one	creating	2015-05-20T13:21:22.012Z
# euca-create-volume -s 8 -z two
VOLUME	vol-172cdb42	8		two	creating	2015-05-20T13:21:46.286Z
# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-7074a3a8	10		one	available	2015-05-20T13:21:22.012Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-172cdb42	8		two	available	2015-05-20T13:21:46.286Z	standard
{code}
# Created a snapshot from _vol-172cdb42_ (SC02)
{code}
# euca-create-snapshot vol-172cdb42
SNAPSHOT	snap-e41c6adc	vol-172cdb42	pending	2015-05-20T13:27:37.978Z	000700183858	8
{code}
# Waited till the snapshot reached 25%, then stopped the 'eucalyptus-cloud' process on SC02
{code}
# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-e41c6adc	vol-172cdb42	pending	2015-05-20T13:27:37.978Z	25%	000700183858	8
[root@h-23 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud stop
Stopping Eucalyptus services: done.
{code}
# Started the 'eucalyptus-cloud' process back up on SC02, then waited till it reached ENABLED state
{code}
[root@h-23 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud start
Starting Eucalyptus services: done.
# euca-describe-storage-controllers
STORAGECONTROLLER	two            	two-sc-1       	10.111.5.23              	NOTREADY	{}
STORAGECONTROLLER	one            	one-sc-1       	10.111.5.5               	ENABLED	{}
....
# euca-describe-storage-controllers
STORAGECONTROLLER	two            	two-sc-1       	10.111.5.23              	ENABLED	{}
STORAGECONTROLLER	one            	one-sc-1       	10.111.5.5               	ENABLED	{}
{code}
# Checked the status of the snapshot to confirm it was in the 'failed' state
{code}
# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-e41c6adc	vol-172cdb42	failed	2015-05-20T13:27:37.978Z	0%	000700183858	8
{code}
# Checked the 'eucalyptus_storage' database to confirm state information was correct in appropriate tables
{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from snapshots where snapshot_name = 'snap-e41c6adc';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |      deletion_time
    | progress | sc_name | should_transfer | snapshot_size_gb | snapshot_point_id | snapshot_name |                                     snapshot_location

                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                bucke
t_name                 | etag |   key_name    |  purge_time   | sc_name |  snapshot_id  |  state  | total_parts | upload_id

*Additional Notes*

After confirming the bug was fixed, I performed additional steps to make sure other functionality wasn't broken.  They included the following:
# After snapshot reached _failed_ state, retried creating a snapshot from the volume - *passed on both clusters*
# While one SC was being stopped/restarted, created a volume on the other SC - *passed on both clusters*
# Created volumes from snapshots associated with volumes that weren't created on the same cluster - *passed on both clusters*

Final results after tests were ran (snapshots and volumes) - only two resources showed in 'failed' state, which is expected.
{code}
# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-563802cd	4		two	available	2015-05-20T14:05:09.166Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-274c3628	4	snap-6d874d5a	one	available	2015-05-20T14:34:00.292Z	standard

VOLUME	vol-4f370899	5	snap-63700417	two	available	2015-05-20T14:34:29.346Z	standard

# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-6d874d5a	vol-563802cd	completed	2015-05-20T14:07:17.512Z	100%	000700183858	4
SNAPSHOT	snap-e41c6adc	vol-172cdb42	failed	2015-05-20T13:27:37.978Z	0%	000700183858	8

SNAPSHOT	snap-6055a378	vol-172cdb42	completed	2015-05-20T14:00:47.958Z	100%	000700183858	8
SNAPSHOT	snap-91d70d6b	vol-7074a3a8	completed	2015-05-20T14:02:51.069Z	100%	000700183858	10
SNAPSHOT	snap-7b39eca8	vol-7074a3a8	failed	2015-05-20T13:55:35.707Z	0%	000700183858	10
SNAPSHOT	snap-80a4f3e2	vol-172cdb42	completed	2015-05-20T13:34:41.962Z	100%	000700183858	8
{code}
